title: Synthetic Recap
body:
SEATTLE (AP) — The Seattle SuperSonics didn’t need a team to beat the Houston Rockets on Sunday. They had Gary Payton.

In a breathtaking, historic performance, Payton authored a masterclass for the ages, single-handedly dismantling the Rockets in a 118-94 victory that was less a basketball game and more a personal showcase for "The Glove."

Payton was simply unstoppable, pouring in a career-high and franchise-record 44 points. But his scoring barrage was only the headline; the entire body of work was a testament to his complete dominance. He dished out 11 assists, orchestrating the offense with surgical precision, and chipped in 6 rebounds for good measure. When he wasn't carving up the defense, he was locking it down, adding 3 steals to his legendary defensive resume.

While Payton orchestrated the symphony, he had a formidable duet partner in Detlef Schrempf, who provided a stellar 24 points and 9 rebounds. But this night belonged unequivocally to Payton. Every crossover, every step-back jumper, and every no-look feed was a reminder of his singular talent.

Houston, led by 21 points from Charles Barkley and 19 from Hakeem Olajuwon, simply had no answer. They were witnesses to a force of nature, a point guard playing at a peak few have ever reached.

The final score tells a story of a blowout, but the real story is etched in the individual stat line of one man. In front of a roaring KeyArena crowd, Gary Payton didn't just win a game; he seized his place in the record books and delivered a performance for the ages.
